page.title: 02Local History of Nailsea
page.content: When the old{ Domesday Book}was created,{Nailsea}was under another name.{Nailsea}originated from{ {Nigel,}who owned the land then. Today,{Nailsea}is mainly a{residential area ; acting as a{"dormitory"}suburb for the many Nailsea residents who work in Bristol. The majority of people travelling to Bristol go by their own transport, such as car or motorcycle.Some other people go by bus or train for a farther destination. Modern Nailsea started to grow very fast in the late 1950's and early 1960's. It had a{modern clinic, {library}and{shopping centre}before most of the new houses were built.
